50 Vita sancti Gregorij.
SEint Gregori þe confessour : in Ciscile was i-bore.
In holienesse he ladde is lijf : þat is soule nere for-lore.
gret clerk he was and guod prechour. : in Cycile he liet a-rere
Sixe Abbeies of Monekes : with-inne a fewe &yogh;eres,
Se seouenþe he dude a-rere : in þe Cite of rome;
Þare he and manie oþur with him : þe Abite of monekes nome.
In so gret fastingue he was : and so luyte he wolde ete,
Þat al is wille he for-les : of drinke and of mete;
For defaute he scholde raþur deie : þane beo of-houngred ene—
So he was to fastingue i-woned : his lijf he ladde so clene.
Wel sielden for al is feblesse : Idel he beo scholde,[r. wolde.]
Þat of ore louerdes seruise : rede oþur singue he [no]lde[MS. wlde, w over an erasure.]
Oþur writen oþur telle : oþur rimes þar-of make,
Oþur he wolde bidde is beden : þe &yogh;wyle he mi&yogh;te wake.
Þe pope is guodnesse under-&yogh;at : þei he þare-of were stille :
At rome he made him cardinal : al a-&yogh;ein is wille.
So wijs and holi he was in þou&yogh;te : and so ri&yogh;tful of is dede,
Þat þe conseil of holie churche : muche was bi is rede.—
Out of is paleys in a day : þis holie man gan i-wiende :
he founde Marchauns at rome : with Mercerie wel hiende.
to sullen huy ladden on heore hond : swete children þreo,
Fairore þingus þane huy weren : ne mi&yogh;te no man i-seo.
Seint Gregori &yogh;eorne heom bi-heold : a stounde he gan at-stonde,
And axede &yogh;wat þe childre weren : and of &yogh;wuche londe.
Þe Marchaunz seiden, "Englische huy beoth : of Engelonde i-nome,
And swuch is þe kuynde of alle þe men : þat of þat lond doz come."
"Wel au&yogh;te," seide þis holie man : "þat lond beo guod and riche,
For[al. om.] huy beoth Englische swyþe wel i-cleoped : engles huy buth i-liche.
&YOGH;if þat [lond][om.] is swuch ase [þe][om.] men beoth : name it hauez with ri&yogh;te,
Englene lond it au&yogh;te wel beo : and engles þare-inne a-li&yogh;te;
And swuch folk au&yogh;te in heouene : beon englene i-fere."
Þo Axede he &yogh;wat bi-leue : in engelonde were.
Þe marchaunz seiden, "al engelond : is puyr heþenesse."
"Alas," seide seint Gregori : "a-las, þe sorienesse
Þat þe prince of þe deorke helle : schal habbe in powere
A lond fol of so fair folk : þat au&yogh;ten beo Engles i-fere!"
he wende a-&yogh;ein in-to is paleis : with wel dreorie chere,
And carede muche þat in Engelond : cristinedom i-brou&yogh;t nere.
At þe commuyn conseil a day : seint Gregori a-ros sone,
And bad þe pope and is cardinales : graunti him ane bone,
Þat huy him senden in-to engelond : to prechie cristinedom.
Þo[al. om.] þe pope mid is cardinales : gret conseil þar-of nam;
Nolden huy him graunti nou&yogh;t. : ake euere he bad so faste,
Þat huy dorsten werne none lengore : and graunteden atþe laste.
Seint Gregori was þo glad i-nou&yogh;! : he nolde a-bide non lengore more,
Þo wende he toward engelonde : to prechie godes lore.
A-non so he was fram rome i-wend : defaute of him men hadde;
Þat folk cam to þe pope al day[om. al day] : and echone on him huy gradde,
Ase he to seint peteres munstre i-wende : þo in ane dai&yogh;e,
"Þou þencst," huy seiden, "with þi conseil : al rome to bi-trai&yogh;e;
he þat halt op þe conseile of Rome : heonnes þou hast i-send;
bote þou him of-sende sone : al rome worth i-schend."
Þe pope hadde gret loue ei&yogh;e : of þat þe folk him seide.[A v. om.]
he nas nou&yogh;wer nei&yogh; atþe se : are he him of-sende.
With wel dreorie chere þo : þis holie man a&yogh;en wende.—
Ase god it wolde, þare-aftur-ward : sone it dude bi-falle
Þat þe pope wende out of þe world : so we schullen alle.
Þe cardinales and þe bischopes : and al þat conseil of rome,
Ane pope to cheose afturward : alle to-gadere huy come.
huy hieten þat ech man þat of þe conseile was : eche dai&yogh;e faste scholde
And in heore bedes beon ni&yogh;t and day : &yogh;if ore louerd heom sende wolde
Ani tokningue a-mong heom : &yogh;if ani of heom wuyrþe were
In rome pope for-to beo : cristine men wel to lere.
Þo huy hadden in heore oresones i-beon : þreo daies and þreo ni&yogh;t,
In þe huyrne of one chapele : huy sei&yogh;en swyþe gret li&yogh;t,
Þat stod ase þei hit a piler were : into heouene up-ri&yogh;t—
huy ne i-sei&yogh;en neuer er no þing : so cler ne so bri&yogh;t.
Þo huy comen to þe place : onder þe li&yogh;te huy founde
Þane holie man, seint Gregori : plat i-falle to grounde;
For werinesse of is oresones : he lai al[al. as] in suoddringue.
Þat folk bi-gan to herien god : and loude huy guonne si[n]gue;
huy nomen þesne holie man : and maden him pope a-non.
Fair and swete was þat li&yogh;t : þat op-on him schon!—
Swiþe wel he wuste cristine-dom : and holie lijf he ladde.
Of þe mis-bi-leue of Engelonde : gret deol and care he hadde.
Seint Austin was a Monek þo : him and oþere he nam
And sende heom in-to engelonde : to prechi cristindom.
¶ Seint Austin and is Monekus : þo huy weren in Engelonde,
wide huy precheden cristindom— : i-hered beo godes sonde.
Seint Austin wende to þe kingues court : and so he prechede þere,[v. 80-3 al. om.]
Þat þe king and alle is men : sone i-baptizede were.
Þo huy hadde i-brou&yogh;t in-to godes lawe : þene kyng and is pouwer,
Þ t folk tornede þoru&yogh; godes grace : to him feor and ner.
So longue þat þis holie men : heore wille hadden at þen ende,
Þat al folk of eche toune : to cristindom gan i-wende.
Þo wende seint Austin a-&yogh;en. : þe pope he tolde at rome[v. 86-95 al. om.]
hou alle þe men of engelonde : cristin-dom nome.
Þo was þe pope seint Gregori : i-brou&yogh;t in grete blisse,
And liet seint Austyn wende a-&yogh;en : þat lond more to wisse
And make Bischopes and Ercedeknes : and oþure prelatus al-so,
Cristin-dom to witie in engelonde : þat men ne scholde neuere ondo.
Seint Austin wende a-non a-&yogh;en : and þo he to engelonde cam,
Twelf bischopes þare-inne he made : to witien cristin-dom,
And oþere prelates of holi churche : þat we a-mong us i-seoth.
In þis manere to cristindom : alle i-brou&yogh;t we beoth
Þoru&yogh; þe bone of seint gregori : þat hidere sende is sonde;
Þare-fore we cleopiez him in holie bok : Apostul of Engelonde,
For he us sende ore ri&yogh;te bi-leue : þat we[overlined.] holdez &yogh;uyte,[The text is corrupted here.]
And in his dai&yogh;e sette children to lore : þe &yogh;wyle huy beoth luyte—
God for þe loue of seint gregori : þulke lore us leue so wite,
Þat he us sende bi seint Austin : and neuereft hire for-&yogh;ite.
Wel au&yogh;ten cristine men to louien him : þat in ri&yogh;te bi-leue heom brou&yogh;te;
For he was þe furste man : þat cristin-dom to hem bi-sou&yogh;te.[This v. is corrupted.]—
Muche folk þare was in Rome : þat in guode bi-leue nere
Ne bi-lieueden nou&yogh;t þat þe sacringe : ore louerdes licame were.
Þare-fore þe pope seint Gregori : prechede heom a day,
And þare-of schewede heom fair miracle : þat ech of heom it sai&yogh; :
Of ore louerdes licame a luyte he brac : bi-fore heom ase huy stode:
Sone it bi-cam to a luyte childes fingur : al wringuynde[al. vrninge] a-blode.
huy bi-liefden wel þo aftur-ward : on ihesu crist ech-on,
And onder-stoden þet sacrement : þoru&yogh; lore of þat holie mon.[110-1 al. om.]
Þus þe holie man seint Gregori : pope was in rome,
And sende us in-to engelonde : þe lawes of cristindome.
holi churche and cristindom : þoru&yogh; him was so i-loked here,
Þat he is nouþe in heouene : with Aungles i-fere.[v. 114-5 al. om.]
Bidde we þanne þene holie man : apostle of Engelonde,
Þat he bi-fore ihesu crist : ore neode ounder-stonde.
